Epsilon Systems C5I (https://www.epsilonsystems.com/c5i)is focused on software development and systems engineering for complex command, control, intelligence and combat systems is seeking software engineers with 6+ years’ experience for work in San Diego, CA supporting an Intelligence, Surveillance, Reconnaissance and Target (ISR&T) web development project. Our engineering efforts provide the warfighter with tools support critical support to operational missions to improve targeting capabilities. If you have a passion for excellence in engineering and enjoy working on challenging projects in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment – read on!

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Design, develop, and implement web applications to power a national ISR&T toolset with a large user base.
  • Performsystems administration duties
  • Write well designed, testable and efficient code that meets technical requirements.
  • Work closely with users to troubleshootcode defects and deploytimely fixes.
  • Participate in a highly collaborative team environment, contributing to all phases of the development lifecycle.
  • Deploy applications on classified and secured networks
  • Deliver projects on time and with attention to quality.

Required Qualifications
  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
  • A minimum of six (6) years of experience inSoftware Design, Development, Test, and Evaluation.
  • Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance. TS/SCI clearance preferred.
  • Hands on experience withJava, C++, JavaScript, React.js, Web Services.
  • Experience programming within a cloud environment (AWS preferred).
  • Experience with modern version control systems (i.e., SVN, Git).
  • Experience administering/monitoring Windows Servers (including security requirements) andupgrading operational systems.
  • Good interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of business users and management.
  • Ability to work individually and on team projects in an environment of teamwork and cooperation.
  • Effective written, oral, and presentation skills.
  • Pursuant to the various government contractual requirements, all applicants must be U.S. Citizens.

Preferred Qualifications
  • Understanding of relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred).
  • Knowledge of geospatial systems (MSP, CGS, Openlayers, leaflet.js, GeoServer).
  • Knowledge of imagery formats (NITF, GeoTIFF).
  • Knowledge of Identity Management (GeoAxis).

ADA Notations
  • Able to handle prolonged sitting and use of computer.
  • Office environment.

Epsilon Systems Solutions Inc.and its subsidiaries are proud to be Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans.

whole_unnormalized_body:
What We'll Bring

At iovation, we have a welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation we’re constantly exploring new technologies and tools to be agile. This environment gives our people the opportunity to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.

Come be a part of our team – you’ll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology.

What You'll Bring
  • At least 4 years of operations experience, including several years of demonstrated experience supporting a production environment
  • Demonstrated practical problem solving, communication and documentation skills
  • Ability to perform root cause analysis and engage other stakeholders when appropriate
  • Knowledge of systems management tools such as Puppet or Chef and concepts of configuration management in a large-scale environment
  • Practical knowledge of at least one scripting language (Bash, Ruby, Python, Perl)
  • Ability to assess tradeoffs and make decisions collaboratively in a cross-functional team
  • Comfortable with the event-driven nature of our work

We’d Love To See
  • Exposure to capacity planning practices or methodologies
  • Experience operating monitoring systems like Nagios, Sensu, Zabbix, etc.
  • Experience operating time-series databases like Graphite, InfluxDB, or Prometheus
  • Experience operating Elasticsearch, Kafka, RabbitMQ, or Redis in a production environment
  • Experience operating containers (Docker, rkt) in a production setting
  • Experience using Kubernetes, Marathon, Docker Swarm or another container orchestration platform
  • Experience troubleshooting and/or building systems in the JVM
  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL data stores
  • Exposure to Test Driven Development (TDD)
  • Open source project contributor

Impact You'll Make
  • Building, supporting and maintaining platforms used across the technology organization to deliver iovation’s products. These platforms include things like:
    • Docker and Kubernetes
    • Jenkins CI/CD
    • Metrics and observability systems (logstash, graphite, sensu)
    • Configuration management systems (puppet, chef, ansible)
  • Troubleshoot issues with our systems at all levels of the stack by performing deep problem analysis to identify root cause and appropriate resolution
  • Work to reduce manual toil through automation and development of standardized practices for managing systems and services
  • Take part in a 24x7 on-call rotation (current on-call rotation is once every 9 weeks)
  • Perform routine care and feeding tasks of the operating environments including system upgrades and ensuring environmental consistency
  • Create and improve tools for managing, testing, and measuring usage of our systems
  • Work with open source tools and projects with the freedom to contribute changes back to the community

Tools We Use
  • Ruby, Python, Perl, Git, Go, Java, Groovy
  • RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, Kafka, ActiveMQ, Postgresql
  • Puppet, Rundeck, Docker, Kubernetes, CentOS
  • Sensu, Collectd, Graphite, Grafana
  • Jenkins, maven
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

Activision Blizzard Media is a rapidly growing business built to connect brands with our 350M+ global player base across Activision, Blizzard and King.

We create premium, innovative advertising experiences for world- class casual mobile games like King's Candy Crush Saga. Looking ahead, we plan to launch advertising across the Activision Blizzard portfolio, including high growth areas like esports. This is an exciting time to join this growing business.

Are you excited about working alongside some of the largest advertisers in the world to help them prove the value of in- game advertising? If yes, this job is for you.
Your role within Activision Blizzard Media

A Typical Day Could Include

We are hiring a Research Analyst in New York. You will work within the Marketing, Measurement and Insights (MMI) team across a range of projects.
  • Programming and distributing a survey on our research community, asking players about their thoughts on the latest Candy Crush game
  • Using syndicated datasets to help convince an Automotive client to buy our advertising inventory
  • Fact checking a presentation on 2019 gaming trends
  • Sourcing and synthesizing industry reports to help update our insight- based marketing material
  • Analyzing the results of a campaign effectiveness study for an Entertainment client
  • Team brainstorm on a qualitative discussion guide for in- home ethnographic research

You will be part of a team that spans the globe with hubs in London, San Francisco, New York and Los Angeles.

Candidates should be knowledgeable about the advertising industry, passionate about the entertainment business, and have experience in both qualitative and quantitative research methodologies. Candidates must be comfortable using data to develop actionable insights and effectively communicate a story on behalf of advertising clients. They should also be open to switching between projects and balancing competing priorities and stakeholders.

Skills To Create Thrills
  • 1- 2 years of research experience working at a market research firm, digital platform or gaming company
  • Proven ability to analyze data and create marketing insights
  • You are experienced in deploying, programming and/or writing surveys
  • You are curious about the "why" behind data, and eager to ask questions and learn
  • Experience or familiarity with survey software (Qualtrics, Vision Critical), data analysis software (SPSS, Excel), and syndicated survey data (Simmons, MRI, Comscore)

Bonus Points
  • You are detail- oriented with the ability to prioritize, organize and summarize data
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills; comfortable discussing research methodologies and findings
  • Keen interest in developing data language skills (SQL, R) and campaign measurement experience (Millward Brown, Nielsen etc.)
  • Interest in gaming across a variety of platforms (mobile, console, PC, esports etc.)

  • You are detail- oriented with the ability to prioritize, organize and summarize data
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills; comfortable discussing research methodologies and findings
  • Previous experience working at a market research firm, media agency, digital platform or gaming company
  • Keen interest in developing data language skills (SQL, R) and campaign measurement experience (Millward Brown, Nielsen etc.)
  • Interest in gaming across a variety of platforms (mobile, console, PC, esports etc.)


    • About Activision And Our Family Of Brands

    King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one (or more!) of our games. We have developed more than 200 fun titles and offer games in over 200 countries and regions. King has game studios in Barcelona, Berlin, Bucharest, London, Malmö and Stockholm along with offices in San Francisco, Chicago, LA, Malta, New York, and Tokyo. King is an independent unit of Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq: ATVI) which acquired King in February 2016.

    Activision Blizzard is a member of the Fortune 500 and S&P 500, and the world's most successful standalone interactive entertainment company.

    We delight hundreds of millions of monthly active users around the world every day through franchises including Activision's Call of Duty®, Destiny and Skylanders®, Blizzard Entertainment's World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, and Heroes of the Storm®, and King's Candy Crush™, Pet Rescue™, Bubble Witch™ and Farm Heroes™.

    We’ve been one of Fortune’s "100 Best Companies To Work For®" for the last four years. Headquartered in Santa Monica, California, we have operations throughout the world, and our games are played in 196 countries.

    More information about our company and products can be found on our website, www.activisionblizzard.com.
    A great saga needs all sorts of heroes
    Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.
    Apply now!
    Want to join our Kingdom? You’ll find all you need to apply, plus more information on our culture, values and benefits, including relocation packages at jobs.king.com. All applications should be made in English.

Description SSAS Developer to work on their existing platform and take on new features as they emerge. This is a fast-paced team that operates in an agile environment. They do weekly sprints. For new solutions, they release daily. The ideal candidate is a motivated individual that is excited about making an impact to a user base of over 20k that is ready to operate in a fast-paced environment and can clearly demonstrate a thirst for learning and mastering emerging technologies, processes, and tools in the analytics space. whole_unnormalized_body:
The system applications architect is responsible for designing, developing and bringing online specific scientific information systems of the company. The system applications architect is also responsible for creating, modifying and developing computer software by converting project requirements into code either directly or through staff, to increase productivity and efficiency of the company.

Responsibilities

Work with management and team members to design system applications to make the company more productive.

Manage and coordinate objectives through agile project management.

Confirms project requirements by reviewing computer program objectives, input data, and output requirements.

Encodes project requirements by converting workflow information into computer language.

Confirms software program operation by conducting tests; modifying program sequence and/or codes.

Develop Validation Protocols, Instrument and Computer System Validation Plans, Requirement Specifications, Instrument IQOQPQs, Software IQOQPQs, Traceability Matrixes, Validation Summary Reports, SOPs, SIPs, and SEPs.

Maintains historical records by documenting program development and revisions in an accurate and legible manner.

Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Ensure regulatory compliance for information technology.

Must Have

Certification and proven experience in Information Technology

Experience with the following essential; Python | C#.NET | ASP.NET | JavaScript | XML | SQL | HTML | CSS | Entity Framework | AJAX | LINQ | MVC | SQL Server | jQuery | jQuery Mobile | JIRA Cloud Technology | AWS

Knowledge of accounting principles preferred

What's great in the job?
  • Support the discovery and development of life saving remedies.
  • Be part of a vibrant company.
  • An Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

We are looking for candidates for the following direct client position. If you are interested in below position, please forward your updated resume and rate requirement. If you are not interested but know someone who might be, please feel free to forward this email.

Job Title Hadoop Administrator Location Middletown, PA Duration 6+ months

Note The position will be remote until the situation changes.

Primary Responsibilities Administrate the big data platforms such as Cloudera Hadoop Provide a stable production environment that meets performance needs and scalability Triage production systems in a timely manner including on-call support as needed and maintain auditsecurity. Working with data scientists, BI team and customer to plan and manage Lead and execute BI system implementations and upgrades, license management, security, and futureadditional product evaluations by working with data scientists, architects and business units Practice Root Cause Analysis to determine the scope and scale of issue impact. Create epicsstories and construct automation to prevent problem recurrence. Communicate status of production issues with both the business and the Data Insights and Analytics team in a timely manner. Proactively develop, coordinate, and provide on-going training, functional, and technical direction to the super-users (content developers). Define and document application best practices, required standards, processes, and guidelines regarding the use and administration of the BI tools. Standardize the development process for the content developers. Install and configure various components of Data platform and maintain their integrity Deploy and maintain a Hadoop cluster, adding and removing nodes using cluster monitoring tools like Ganglia Nagios or Cloudera Manager Work closely with the database team, network team, BI team and application teams to make sure that all the big data applications are highly available and performing as expected. Manage all aspects of our AWS infrastructure (compute, storage, network, permissions, cost) using configuration management tools like Ansible, Cloud Formation and shell scripts Assist in designing, automating, implementing and sustainment of Amazon machine images (AMI) across Cloud environment. Configure S3 buckets with various life cycle policies to archive the infrequently accessed data to storage classes based on requirement. Implement and sustain Amazon machine images (AMI) across Cloud environment Capacity planning and estimating the requirements for lowering or increasing the capacity of the Hadoop cluster. Monitor the cluster connectivity and performance. Backup and recovery tasks Resource and security management Troubleshoot application errors and ensure that they do not occur again Vendor Interaction

You Must Have

8+ years of experience in maintaining large databases on both cloud and on-premises 5+ years of experience in Bigdata administration using Cloudera stack Hands-on experience on Cloudera installation, configuration, debugging, tuning and administration. Must have prior Cloudera Hadoop cluster deployment experience from the scratch. Hands-on experience on Cloudera, working with data delivery teams to setup new Hadoop users. This includes setting up Linux users, setting up Kerberos principals and testing HDFS, Hive. Competency in Red Hat Linux administration (security, configuration, tuning, troubleshooting and monitoring). Expert knowledge on Active DirectoryLDAP security integration with Cloudera Big Data platform. Performance tuning experience of Cloudera clusters and Spark (PySpark, Spark, Language R) and MapReduce routines. Experience Optimizing clusters for future workloads. Experience with VPC, Subnets, and Route tables Hands-on experience on node management, monitoring and response, support processes creation, upgrades and patches, logging configuration and managing user rights and space quota. Working knowledge of Networks, Linux OS and Unix Shell Scripting. Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, data science, data analytics, interactive media, or related field Experience working on Agile projects and Agile methodology in general

We Value Experience in data modeling, database design and development. Hadoop, AWS and Azure certifications is a plus

Physical Demands Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA and other federal, state and local standards Sedentary work that involves sitting or remaining stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc. Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer, utilizing a mouse, keyboard and monitor We are looking for candidates for the following direct client position. position: Maneuver Warfare CONOPS Developer with Security Clearance- Apply now!
whole_unnormalized_body:
Overview JHNA is seeking candidates for a full-time position working as a Senior Maneuver Warfare Subject Matter Expert (SME) developing Concepts of Operation (CONOPs) for future robotic combat vehicle applications. This position will assist the Next Generation Combat Vehicle-Cross Functional Team located at the Detroit Arsenal in Warren, Michigan, however it will sit in Washington, DC. This position will coordinate with academia, industry, and several government agencies. Responsibilities include direct coordination of concepts development with the Army's Maneuver Center of Excellence, the Maneuver Support Center of Excellence, Aviation Center of Excellence, and Support Center of Excellence. Concepts created will ultimately assist the Army Staff Lead for Ground Robotics with program management strategy, prioritizing systems within the Army budget, linking Army capability gaps with solutions, informing the Joint Ground Robotics community. Come join a certified Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) that is focused on providing engineering and technical services primarily to the US Army Aviation, US Navy Aviation, and the autonomous systems communities. JHNA offers highly competitive benefit packages and a culture that fosters teamwork and collaboration all while supporting our Warfighter! Responsibilities
  • CONOPs Development in Support of Requirements Systems Integration (RSO): Generation of Advanced Maneuver Concepts for Robotic Combat Vehicle (RCV) development
  • Generation of Power Point presentations depicting Operational Concepts
  • Integrating robotics and autonomous ground systems concepts into emerging programs that support Army prioritization, RCV family of systems.
  • Staff Synchronization and Integration with CFT designated entities- harmonizing and integrating with various industry, academia and government stakeholders relating to RCV development.
  • O ther duties may be assigned, as necessary. Qualifications REQUIRED:
  • Masters Degree Required. Master of Science degree is preferred.
  • Candidate must posess or be able to posess a government issued DoD Clearance
  • Candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills and be a self-starter that is prepared to work across multiple programs.
  • Must be capable of expressing operational concepts in written and pictorial format. Tasks will specifically describe maneuver-oriented missions or scenarios and basic elements of task-to-subtask decomposition as a part of the interview process.
  • Must have the ability to decompose Army Universal Task List (AUTL) components into tasks and subtasks
  • Maneuver Warfare leadership experience is required. Ideal candidate will have battalion command experience or above.
  • Ideal candidates will possess recent Unmanned Aerial System or Unmanned Ground Vehicle capabilities development experienc DESIRED SKILLS:
  • Conventional Maneuver Warfare experience is critical; however, we also desire the applicant to have experience in the development of system engineering concepts and documents.
  • An engineering background experience with either military ground maneuver platforms or robotics and autonomous systems is advantageous. Power Point animation skills and/or video editing experience is preferred. SECURITY CLEARANCE: Individual must have, or be capable of obtaining, a Secret security clearance Overview JHNA is seeking candidates for a full-time position working as a Senior Maneuver Warfare Subject Matter Expert (SME) developing Concepts of Operation (CONOPs) for future robotic combat vehicle applications. JHNA offers highly competitive benefit packages and a culture that fosters teamwork and collaboration all while supporting our Warfighter! Responsibilities
  • CONOPs Development in Support of Requirements Systems Integration (RSO): Generation of Advanced Maneuver Concepts for Robotic Combat Vehicle (RCV) development

  • Integrating robotics and autonomous ground systems concepts into emerging programs that support Army prioritization, RCV family of systems.
  • Staff Synchronization and Integration with CFT designated entities- harmonizing and integrating with various industry, academia and government stakeholders relating to RCV development.
  • O ther duties may be assigned, as necessary. Qualifications REQUIRED:
  • Masters Degree Required. Master of Science degree is preferred.
  • Candidate must posess or be able to posess a government issued DoD Clearance
  • Candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills and be a self-starter that is prepared to work across multiple programs.

position: Software Engineer Intern (Technical) with Security Clearance- Apply now!
whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Responsibilities Davidson Technologies Inc. Is seeking an Software Engineer Intern (Technical) at Schriever Air Force Base in Colorado Springs, CO. Software Engineering Intern to provide engineering support for the Modeling and OperationsSoftware (MOS) Directorate Sensor Modeling Center (SMC) organization on the JRDC program at Schriever AFB, CO. The Software Engineering Intern will work with a team of engineers and analysts in the architecture, design, implementation and maintenance of a suite of sensor models, used for element and system level analysis. The Software Engineering Intern will aid in providing software analysis and coordination of element and system-level performance parameters across multiple teams within SMC Qualifications Requirements: * Candidate for a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field, currently studying or have knowledge of C++ and one other programming language, familiarity with Linux and/or Unix based development, familiarity with the phases of software development, knowledge in object-oriented software development methodologies, able to work both independently and in a team environment, strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. * Must have a 3.5 GPA or higher Preferred Qualifications: * Strong background in math and physics, knowledge / experience in several of the following: * Missile defense domain * GPU Programming * CUDA * Open CL * Java * MySQL * Modeling and simulation, or parallel computing * Current DoD Secret clearance Clearance:
Must have or be able to obtain a Secret or interim Secret level clearance by internship start dates. Date of graduation must be later than Spring, 2017 Job Responsibilities Davidson Technologies Inc. Must have or be able to obtain a Secret or interim Secret level clearance by internship start dates. Date of graduation must be later than Spring, 2017

position: Jr. Systems Architect 2019-S-102 with Security Clearance- Apply now!
whole_unnormalized_body:
Intelligence Consulting Enterprise Solutions, INC. is looking for a Jr. Systems Architect. Description: Join ICES on a contract impacting national security as a Jr. Systems Architect. These positions are located in Chantilly, VA. All positions require US Citizenship and an active/current TS/SCI security clearance and be willing and able to pass an additional polygraph as needed. As a Jr. Systems Architect, specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Duties The successful candidate will have experience as a full stack web developer, capable of producing high-quality visualizations for senior level decision making as well as subject matter experts. Candidate will be able to work individually and in group settings to provide rapid prototyping of visualizations. Candidate will help conduct Analysis of Alternative (AoA) studies for new and upgraded software, as well as assist with their implementation plans. Specific task responsibilities may include:
  • Development and deployment of graph data store queries and statistical algorithms against to identify patterns, trends and issues in both architecture data sets to support enterprise engineering and IT acquisition planning and decision making functions.
  • Outreach and engagement with industry, academia and other Government agencies and programs involved with the use and development of emerging MBSE approaches methods and techniques.
  • Develop architectural assessments, presentations, white papers and other analyses, as required.
  • Communicate architecture concepts and demonstrate value to customers not versed in architecture principles.
  • Be able to learn and utilize various javascript libraries (D3.js, Leaflet.js, Bootstrap 4.0, JQuery, etc...) to create web applications.
  • Develop visualizations through the entire lifecycle of concept, design, development, and maintenance.
  • Show a willingness to stay up to date on the current best practices and tools as architecture liaison to identify and extract architecture data sets to support enterprise engineering meta-modeling and modeling activities. Required Qualifications:
  • Active TS/SCI clearance
  • BS in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
  • 1+ years in Systems Engineering or related field
  • 1+ years' experience with IC, NSG or NGA operations (including mission partners)
  • Development of analytical algorithms using R or Python
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to independently execute work tasks in a rapidly changing, fast-paced environment
  • Superior interpersonal, written and communications skills with the ability to interface with different personalities in a range of positions, including many at very senior levels.
  • 2+ years with data visualization tools
  • Experience with programming in HTML5 and knowledge of web based visualization libraries such as D3 and Leaflet. Desired Qualifications:
  • MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
  • Knowledge in architecture development and analysis (Preferablly DoDAF), requirements and Interfaces analysis
  • Knowledge of MBSE approaches, methods and techniques applied to the development of integration of enterprise and system level architecture products
  • Systems modeling and analysis using SysML or UPDM
  • Experience with any of the following MBSE tools: MagicDraw, CAMEO, CORE, Innoslate, IBM Rhapsody, Unicom System Architect
  • Knowledge of graph data stores and querying technologies
  • Knowledge and understanding of the GEOINT ground systems
  • INCOSE Certification
  • Working knowledge of agile engineering principles, Scrum agile, or SAFe Agile methodologie
  • Experience working with database (e.g. Neo4j, MySQL, Cassandra)
  • Prior use of content management and version control tools (e.g. GIT)
  • Knowledge or prior use with Business Analytic Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik Sense) Intelligence Consulting Enterprise Solutions, INC. is looking for a Jr. Systems Architect. position: Senior Data Engineer & Scientist - Agritech Startup
whole_unnormalized_body:
Senior Data Engineer & Scientist - Agritech Startup
  • One of the fastest growing startup
  • Lean Team
    • About Our Client
    One of the fastest growing Indonesian agritech startup, with B2B and B2C platforms, who is committed to empower local fresh produces communities with their ecosystems and supply chain through technology. Recently received A series funding from Singapore and US based ventures.

    Job Description
    • Build highly available distributed computing systems and data pipelines at scale
    • Design large data warehouses, high performance data processing pipelines, and developing ETL tools or equivalent
    • Integrate to various data sources: Databases (SQL & NoSQL), Text Files, Log Files, etc.
    • Understanding of software design principles and best practices (test driven development, source control management etc.)
    • Transform various data formats: tables, delimited text, free text, JSON, etc
    • Proficient with, but not limited to, the following stacks: SQL & NoSQL, code with Shell & Python, Cloud computing i.e. GCP, AWS and UNIX environment.
    The Successful Applicant
    We are looking for great technical skills and beyond; a talent with enormous sense of ownership with growth mindset, equipped with integrity, positivity and excellent communication skills.
    • Minimum of 3-8 years of professional experience in the field. Graduate from reputable university is preferred
    • Fluency with SQL & NoSQL databases and datawarehouse concepts
    • Savvy in coding with Shell script & Python
    • Familiar with cloud based infrastructure (GCP, AWS, etc.) and UNIX environment
    • Knowledge on data architecture, data structure and data governance.
    • Excellent written and verbal communication, able to switch between technical and plain language when discussing work
    • Able to plan and schedule work in cooperation with business, project and product leads
    • Able to work in teams, understand and empathize with all major stakeholders, take the lead on initiatives and direct and manage data engineers
    • Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment

    What's On Offer
    • Lean team in a growing startup
    • Enormous sense of ownership - running business as if it's your own
    • Competitive benefits
    Contact: Josephine Wiliputri
    Quote job ref: 4132363

whole_unnormalized_body:
Please see the job description below and send your resume with following details to ashish.pandeysaibber108.com

Title Hadoop Administrator Locations Middletown, PA Duration 6 Months

Additional Details This is an immediate position. Position will be remote until climate changes Phone interview will happen quickly Must have 8 years of IT and 5 years in Hadoop (must have Cloud)

Description Job Profile Summary

Primary Responsibilities Administrate the big data platforms such as Cloudera Hadoop Provide a stable production environment that meets performance needs and scalability Triage production systems in a timely manner including on-call support as needed and maintain auditsecurity. Working with data scientists, BI team and customer to plan and manage Lead and execute BI system implementations and upgrades, license management, security, and futureadditional product evaluations by working with data scientists, architects and business units Practice Root Cause Analysis to determine the scope and scale of issue impact. Create epicsstories and construct automation to prevent pro blem recurrence. Communicate status of production issues with both the business and the Data Insights and Analytics team in a timely manner. Proactively develop, coordinate, and provide on-going training, functional, and technical direction to the super-users (content developers). Define and document application best practices, required standards, processes, and guidelines regarding the use and administration of the BI tools. Standardize the development process for the content developers. Install and configure various components of Data platform and maintain their integrity Deploy and maintain a Hadoop cluster, adding and removing nodes using cluster monitoring tools like Ganglia Nagios or Cloudera Manager Work closely with the database team, network team, BI team an d application teams to make sure that all the big data applications are highly available and performing as expected. Manage all aspects of our AWS infrastructure (compute, storage, network, permissions, cost) using configuration management tools like Ansible, Cloud Formation and shell scripts Assist in designing, automating, implementing and sustainment of Amazon machine images (AMI) across Cloud environment. Configure S3 buckets with various life cycle policies to archive the infrequently accessed data to storage classes based on requirement. Implement and sustain Amazon machine images (AMI) across Cloud environment Capacity planning and estimating the requirements for lowering or increasing the capacity of the Hadoop cluster. Monitor the cluster connectivity and performance. Backup and recovery tasks Resource and security management Troubleshoot application errors and ensure that they do not occur again Vendor Interaction

You Must Have

8+ years of experience in maintaining large databases on both cloud and on-premises 5+ years of experience in Bigdata administration using Cloudera stack Hands-on experience on Cloudera installation, configuration, debugging, tuning and administration. Must have prior Cloudera Hadoop cluster deployment experience from the scratch. Hands-on experience on Cloudera, working with data delivery teams to setup new Hadoop users. This includes setting up Linux users, setting up Kerberos principals and testing HDFS, Hive. Competency in Red Hat Linux administration (security, configuration, tuning, troubleshooting and monitoring). Expert knowledge on Active DirectoryLDAP security integration with Cloudera Big Data platform. Performance tuning experience of Cloudera clusters and Spark (PySpark, Spark, Language R) and MapReduce routines. Experience Optimizing clusters for future workloads. Experience with VPC, Subnets, and Route tables Hands-on experience on node management, monitoring and response, support processes creation, upgrades and patch es, logging configuration and managing user rights and space quota. Working knowledge of Networks, Linux OS and Unix Shell Scripting. Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, data science, data analytics, interactive media, or related field Experience working on Agile projects and Agile methodology in general

We Value Experience in data modeling, database design and development. Hadoop, AWS and Azure certifications is a plus Please see the job description below and send your resume with following details to ashish.pandeysaibber108.com

position: Sr. Web Software Developer- Apply now!
whole_unnormalized_body:
EnMotive is a full-service event services company offering registration, timing, scoring and a wide range of other endurance event solutions. We work with over 1,000 events per year, using a combination of in-house registration software as well as industry leading external race timing software. We are looking for passionate, detail-oriented, computer & technology savvy people with the desire to help grow our eCommerce business and integrate our software solutions to support our mission to becoming “the one stop source” for endurance events. As a Sr. Web Software Developer, you will be part of a growing team working to refine and enhance a suite of consumer-facing websites and eCommerce applications. You should be comfortable working on projects either as part of a small team, or individually depending on the needs of the project. The ideal candidate will be a motivated, opinionated developer who is prepared to apply their problem-solving expertise and knowledge of industry practices to make impactful contributions on various application and web development projects from their first day. Responsibilities Include: ● Define site objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning system features and functionality. ● Integrate applications by designing database and server architecture. ● Develop applications by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting problems across multiple environments and platforms. ● Prioritize software development projects and setting timelines. ● Support users by developing documentation and assistance tools. Required Skills: ● 5+ years of PHP application development experience. ● 3 or more years of PHP MVC framework experience. (CakePHP, Laraval or similar) ● 5+ years of relational database experience. ● 2+ years of experience with modern PHP development practices, Composer, Continuous Integration, Version Control, etc. ● 2+ years of UX development experience using SASS, Yarn, Webpack, etc. ● Strong understanding of security and performance requirements of eCommerce software. ● Ability and desire to write clean and testable code. job_description_details.Branża: Technologie i usługi informatyczne

whole_unnormalized_body:
Velo in downtown Palo Alto is the global digital banking brand of East West Bank, one of the largest independent banks headquartered in California. In 2019, Forbes ranked East West Bank as No. 8 in “Best Banks in America”. East West Bank has publicly traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market for more than 20 years (NASDAQ: EWBC)

As our Product Manager (Velo Mobile Banking App), you will play a key role across our product development process, from ideating the next disruptive product innovation to grinding it out to get your killer feature shipped. You will utilize your full range of product superpowers, getting into the weeds with our in-house design and engineering teams to both launch and drive growth across a range of digital banking and personal finance products.

 

You will join our small team of product managers in our Palo Alto office who together are reimagining the future of banking.

 

Responsibilities:


  • Lead a complex product, collaborating with and synthesizing the needs of different teams (Product Management, Compliance, Central Operations, Engineering)
  • Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something valuable for digital banking customers, both US based and those in select international markets
  • We’re a small team so you won’t be asked to be the PM for just a button. Rather you’ll be asked to manage a wide range of products and features and need to prioritize like an animal
  • Provide strategic thinking and leadership
  • Contribute to high-level strategic data-oriented decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams
  • Give and solicit feedback from other PMs to continually raise our bar for quality
  • Participate in the development process from definition, through design, planning, build, test, release, and growth.
  • Stay abreast of product trends and look for creative ideas and inspiration in parallel analogous worlds.

 

Required Experience:


  • 3+ years of Product Management experience with consumer-facing products (mobile banking or personal finance is most ideal)
  • Product strategy, roadmap, UX, feature definition and integration with 3rd parties experience. This includes new product launches, product extensions and ongoing product management.
  • Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent consumer-facing products that were commercially successful; ability to develop differentiated products that uniquely serve target customers
  • Excellent communication skills. Can make a case that is impossible to refute or ignore, using data appropriately, when available, but also tapping into other factors to influence decision makers. 
  • Able to write concise copy that gets the job done. Spends time and energy trying to find the perfect words for key copy (button labels, nav, calls-to-action, etc.), not just words that will suffice.

job_description_details.Branża: Bankowość Usługi finansowe Oprogramowanie komputerowe

whole_unnormalized_body:
IT Group Description

Fixed Income Investment Technology (“FIIT”) group builds software that the Fixed Income business of AB uses in performing functions such as Fundamental Research, Quantitative research, Portfolio Management, Order Generation, Trading and Middle office and Back-Office operations. It partners with business to understand their challenges and help them by providing innovative technology solutions. We re-engineer the process where applicable in collaboration with business to help scale their business and be efficient in this dynamic market conditions. We have an in-house application that is written using C# and Windows forms called Research Analyst Portal (“RAP”) which is the primary tool for Fixed Income. We also have other vendor products which are used in part to do these functions as well.

IT Job Description

We are seeking a Senior Developer - Development Manager to join our Fixed Income Technology team.

Describe The Role

The candidate in this role is expected to work with the architecture team and other senior members of the team to develop a major functional module which handles Portfolio Management and Order generation and Trade Execution for non-taxable business for our rapidly growing Municipal business.

As a part of this role, you would be expected to attend regular meetings with the business and understand their needs and suggest improvements and execute based on project plan. You would also be expected to contribute to the development and enhancement of the existing/new systems, as well as the mentoring of less experienced developers in good coding practices.

Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:

The primary module that the candidate would develop and support will be the Municipal module in RAP. RAP already handles most of the other asset class in Fixed Income space and now is being enhanced to handle Municipal markets. This new module, would help Senior Portfolio Managers, Portfolio Managers, Assistant Portfolio Managers, Fundamental and Quantitative research analysts, Traders, Middle office and Operations functions.

We Have Two Main Technology Stacks

The Windows Forms RAP application is written using C# and WCF as its middle ware. The Web application is written using a combination of C# and Angular, and the middle tier is built using RESTful web services.

Both applications use Oracle as the Primary back-end but Microsoft SQL Server is also used. Both applications are developed and deployed in a Microsoft windows environment.

The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Gathering business requirements from all stakeholders
  • Designing / re-engineering processes
  • Writing technical specifications
  • Designing database architecture, services and user interfaces
  • Developing code, development, unit and integration testing
  • Supporting the QA team as they write test cases
  • Facilitating User Acceptance Testing
  • Launch planning and coordination
  • Post-launch maintenance; enhancement prioritization in conjunction with the business; on-going release management
  • Analyzing and implementing new data models
  • Developing systems for downloading market data from various sources and managing the data repository
  • Providing Level 2 application support
  • Providing support for ad-hoc data and research requests from the investment team
  • Providing support for overnight batch jobs
  • Should be able to work with a large team setting across locations
What makes this role unique or interesting?

This is a unique opportunity to learn and create something along with a business group that manages over 30 Billion dollars. The FIIT team is highly aligned with our business stakeholders and provides a “high touch” opportunity for the programmer analyst to interact with our counterparts on a daily basis.

The role also provides exposure to the entire Software Development Life Cycle. While the developer can draw on resources from other groups as needed, this role affords the opportunity for hands-on experience across the SDLC, including requirements gathering, development, testing and deployment.

What is the professional development value of this role?

There is enormous growth opportunity in this role. From a functional point of view, they would be learning how a municipal investment works from front to back including research, managing portfolio, order sizing and trading. From a technical point of view, they will be working with all the latest technology stack and would be given ample opportunities to research and suggest a technology that solves the business problem.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate should have background in computer science and should have the following skill-sets and experience:
  • BS / MS in Computer Science, Math, Engineering and/or related experience
  • 12 + years of industry experience in coding and building software
  • Experience working or acting as a development team lead
  • Proficient in HTML, JavaScript, Angular 6, C#, Design Patterns, API Development, Data Structures, Algorithms, and SQL
  • Passionate in programming
  • Must be a problem solver and can work independently
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Special Knowledge
  • Finance knowledge a plus
Nashville, TN

whole_unnormalized_body:
The Hatcher Group is seeking a UX design intern to join the firm’s creative team. The design intern will work collaboratively with our award-winning creative team to deliver top-notch solutions for our non-profit and mission-based clients. This is a great position for those looking to work with an enthusiastic team that is committed to always learning and growing, supporting teammates, and improving their community.

A successful candidate should be creatively driven, have an incredible attention to detail, and be able to turn organizational/business objectives into a highly functional user experience.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities Include
  • Support delivery of UX work products such as process flows, personas, sitemaps, wireframes, component libraries, and responsive, mobile-first prototypes
  • Assist creative team with designing print, website and social media graphics to support a variety of initiatives for our clients
  • Identify and solve common design problems with minimal guidance

Qualifications And Desired Skills
  • Current undergraduate or graduate students studying in design (e.g., interactive, user experience, graphic), or equivalent course
  • Strong design skills as demonstrated in a portfolio or work samples
  • Thrive on feedback, critique, and iterations
  • Basic understanding in user-centered design principles along with an incredibly high attention to detail
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively on projects as part of a team
  • Strong work ethic and ability to juggle multiple demands and deadlines
  • Basic understanding of HTML/CSS is a plus
  • Basic understanding of Visual Bakery is a plus
  • Availability to work a minimum of 20 hours per week with flexible scheduling

Experience In The Following Tools
  • Adobe CC Suite (Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign
  • Microsoft Office 365 suite (Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint)
  • Sketch
  • Invision
  • Wordpress is a plus
This is an on site position in our Bethesda, MD office. To be considered, candidates must submit a portfolio of relevant work along with a resume.

About The Hatcher Group

The Hatcher Group is a full-service communications and marketing firm dedicated to inspiring social change for good. We develop strategies that spur people to action and improve people’s lives.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Affusion Consulting has an immediate opportunity for a Senior ETL Developer. Affusion provides high level strategy and implementation services to our large clients. We are an industry leading sophisticated consultancy with a long track record of successful projects and repeat long term engagements. Detailed job requirements are below. This opening is immediate and all qualified candidates will be contacted quickly. Unfortunately we cannot work with third party firms, subcontractors or sponsor visas.

Title

ETL developer

Description

Process and document requirements for technical solutions. Lead role in the design of business solutions with emphasis on developing the database aspects and ETL components of the solution architecture.

Details
  • At least six years of experience in relational database and ETL techniques.
  • Technical skills: Oracle 11g RDBMS, ETL processing
  • Expertise in PL/SQL, optimization, and performance tuning using Oracle RDBMS.
  • Expertise in ETL solution design and techniques
  • Strong background and proficient with Unix shell scripting and a thorough understanding of data warehousing concepts
  • Experience with interacting within a diverse user / customer base
  • Develop, test, and migrate ETL artifacts.
  • Handle initial setup of interface and job schedules and dependencies with Data Center team.
  • Support production batch interfaces and handle error resolution.
  • Define and review test cases for quality assurance
  • Excellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skills
  • Experience working with senior managers and members of other departments.
  • Must be comfortable in working and communicating with customer representatives to expand relationships
Affusion Consulting is a solution provider in Business Intelligence (BI), Enterprise Information Architectures (EIA), and Enterprise Risk Management (ERM). Affusion Consulting distinguishes itself by focusing on the client's business-the business sponsorship, the business problem, the business opportunity, the business alignment and the end user. It is this acute focus and understanding of our clients' business objectives that allows Affusion Consulting to align the correct technologies and processes to provide a complete and successful solution.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Title Software Developer, Staff Location Technica HQ
  • Dulles, VA US (Primary) Education Bachelor's Degree Job Type Full-time Job Description Position Description Technica Corporation is looking for intermediate-level Full Stack Software Engineers. Candidates must have experience using a range of different technologies, languages, and frameworks to develop web applications. Candidates must have an understanding of object-oriented programming and must be comfortable working with both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries. Candidates must possess knowledge of integrating front end JavaScript frameworks with back end APIs. The Engineer will contribute to the development of custom software components and integration of open source code to address customer needs and requirements. Job Requirements (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities) Job Requirements (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)
  • Experienced in full stack web-application development
  • Understanding of software engineering fundamentals, Object-Oriented computer programming, and relational databases
  • Experienced working within an AGILE software development life cycle, including requirements creation, sprint planning and grooming
  • Experience working with front end JavaScript frameworks to create single page applications (Angular version 2 or above, and TypeScript preferred)
  • Experience integrating single page application into server-side API
  • Experience with JavaScript unit testing frameworks (Karma/Jasmine preferred)
  • Experience with end-to-end test frameworks for web applications (protractor preferred)
  • Experience with server side MVC frameworks (Groovy/Grails, Java Spring preferred)
  • Experience working with existing and creating new APIs

whole_unnormalized_body:
Valero provides the energy to take people anywhere they want to go around the globe. Our 10,000 employees work together as a team with the single goal of maintaining our status as a top petroleum refiner and ethanol producer. As an employee at Valero, not only will you have an opportunity to impact people’s lives through the products we manufacture in a safe, reliable environment, you will also be a part of a culture that thrives on positively impacting the people in the communities where we live and work.

As a Database Administration Specialist your primary responsibilities will include building and operating the database infrastructure used by all of Valero’s business applications. You will manage how Valero designs, installs, and maintains the health of our SAP HANA, Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle Database platforms to optimize availability, capacity, configuration, data protection, security, and performance.

You Can Help Achieve This Goal If You Can

Our goal at Valero is to continue to be the premier manufacturer, distributor, and marketer of quality transportation fuels and petrochemical feedstocks, while serving the needs of our employees, communities and stakeholders.
  • Install, configure, upgrade, patch, and operate Valero’s databases to maintain availability, optimal performance, and compliance with Valero standards.
  • Proactively identify and assess any issues, perform troubleshooting, research solutions focusing on root cause.
  • Participate in DBA on-call rotation.

Key Competencies
  • Problem Solving
  • Initiative
  • Results Orientation
  • I nterpersonal Skill
The above description reflects the primary job function and may not include all detailed job functions performed in the role.

This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay.

Job

Information Services

Primary Location:

US-TX-San Antonio

Job Posting

Feb 19, 2020, 3:42:31 PM

Unposting Date

Ongoing

Successful Candidates Will Have
  • A bachelor's degree (or higher) or foreign equivalent degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field required.
  • At least 5 years of DBA experience required.

The Most Competitive Candidates Will Have
  • In-depth understanding of database administration with more than one of the following database platforms: SAP HANA, Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle preferred.
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), and Policy Management preferred.
  • Experience troubleshooting and tuning queries for optimal performance preferred.

Take a Look At Some Of Our Best-in-class Benefits

Need more reasons to work for a company that is both professionally challenging and culturally rewarding.
  • Competitive Pay and Annual Bonus Program
  • 100% match on 401(K) up to 7%, with immediate vesting
  • Company-sponsored Pension Plan
  • Comprehensive Healthcare and Wellness Programs
  • Onsite Daycare Center
  • Onsite Employee & Family Wellness Center
  • State-of-the-art 24-hour Fitness Center free for employees and spouses with access to Tennis and Basketball Facilities
  • Onsite cafeteria open for breakfast and lunch
  • A sprawling campus with walking paths and access to biking/hiking on the greenbelt
Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. For more information, visit Valero.com.

Valero is an EEO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.

whole_unnormalized_body:
The Programmer Analyst will perform the critical function of supporting Programming and Systems Analysis needs at Arcadia University. The Programmer Analyst will be a part of a dynamic IT division and Enterprise Application team. Under the supervision of the Director of Enterprise Applications, this person will code and modify moderate to highly complex programs, including applications/systems integration. He or She will also test and debug code; maintain, modify, and integrate applications. They will also perform analysis and design of programs, edit and approve user as well as application documentation for the use of new and revised systems, including operational documentation.

Arcadia University is a top-ranked private University in greater Philadelphia and a national leader in international education. U.S. News & World Report ranks Arcadia nationally among the top universities in study abroad as well as among the top regional universities in the north. The Princeton Review has named Arcadia among the Best in the Northeast for five consecutive years, while the University’s Physical Therapy and Physician Assistant programs are nationally ranked in their respective categories by U.S. News & World Report. Arcadia University promises a distinctively global, integrative, and personal learning experience that prepares students to contribute and lead in a diverse and dynamic world. Visit www.arcadia.edu .

Applications must be submitted online through Arcadia's Human Resources portal to receive full consideration. Please do not email application materials to hiring manager. Due to the volume of applications received, communication will generally be limited to those candidates that are selected for additional consideration.

For additional information and to apply, please visit: https://careers-arcadia.icims.com/jobs/ and submit a cover letter, resume and names and phone numbers of three professional references.

Application review will begin immediately. Posting will be removed from the website once we've established a sufficient talent pool for consideration.

Arcadia University seeks candidates of diverse cultural backgrounds and abilities. Arcadia University encourages members of underrepresented groups to apply. All offers of employment are conditional based on successful completion of a background check. A selected applicant must have a background check completed prior to commencing employment.

Essential Functions

 Responsibilities

  • Maintains established applications using defined procedures. Arcadia uses Ellucian's PowerCampus as its Student Information System (SIS). The University is implementing SalesForce CRM as its whole student lifecycle engagement platform.
  • Applies and troubleshoots vendor supplied upgrades; follows established methods for integrating or interfacing multiple applications.
  • Work closely with the Enterprise Applications team to support and maintain various applications, integrations both custom and vendor supported.
  • Gathers information and contributes to definition of program requirements, use case, statement of work and proposal development.
  • Implement standards, procedures, and controls to ensure the security, reliability, and availability of enterprise applications.
  • Develop database data warehouse integrations for sharing data among systems based on high quality, streamlined, reusable code
  • Develop reports for the end-user community 8) Establish good working relationships with the Enterprise Application vendors
  • Coordinate efforts related to custom programming requests with the supervisor and peers in the department.
  • Develops and recommends specifications for new applications and proposed changes to existing applications.
  • Provides training and documentation for users. Creates and maintains technical documentation on all custom applications.
  • Maintains familiarity with new technology standards and how each may be applied to the future growth and development of the existing systems at Arcadia University. Work with users and departments to re-engineer business processes

    • Marginal Functions

  • Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

    • Supervision

    Received: This position is supervised by the Director of Application Support

    Given: None

    Qualifications

    Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
    • Excellent communication skills with a demonstrated ability to interact professionally with diverse group of constituents including management, coworkers, users, faculty, students, and vendors.
    • Solid understanding of business practices and a demonstrated ability to effectively map workflows, support Software Applications and make recommendations to automate/improve business/academic processes.
    • Detail oriented with strong analytical skills.
    • Respect and empathy for others.
    • Must be self-motivated and a self-starter with the ability to handle multiple tasks and demands.
    • Familiarity with SQL required.
    • Desire to work as a member of a highly productive team.
    • Sensitivity, good judgment and the ability to handle highly confidential material and information.

    Minimum Qualifications
    • Related Bachelor's degree and/or
    • 5+ years of relevant experience

position: UX Mobile App developer - Wireframe design & prototyping (Remote / Virtual) -Charlotte
whole_unnormalized_body:
Mobile App development We are seeking a UX Business Analyst experience who can do wireframe designs and prototyping. Any BA working closely with Microsites, Healthcare product development will have the Wireframe and UX experience as most of them build the designs to enable in PC, Mobile and tablets. Build a Safety and Quality Healthcare Mobile Application with event based notifications, analytics, reporting and role based access Develop designs using standard UX tools - personas, workflows, wireframes and prototypes. Support development team iterating and developing solutions - communicating both business and design requirements. Closely work with Cross-functional team of Product owner, architects, designers and software developers. Lead UX activities (in person and remote) in an Agile environment such as userdesign research, interviews and workshops Translate usable, useful effective and efficient user experiences within and across the analytic system Work with stakeholders to develop workflows, personas, low and high-fidelity design assets, interactive prototypes, and design specifications Designs, creates and delivers quality requirements of all types - business, stakeholder, functional, non-functional and transition - for software solutions. position: Web Developer/UX Engineer with Security Clearance- Apply now!
whole_unnormalized_body:
Graham Technologies (GTech) is looking for a Web Developer/ UX Engineer in Chantilly, VA to join our fast-growing team of over 70 members! Your role: Graham Technologies is passionate about innovation and we want your help! We believe in each team member having a voice and sharing it to enable both individual and team success. The customer is looking for personnel to support for the design, development, and subsequent maintenance of a suite of services, drop-in UI components, end-user applications, that build upon and augment existing Sponsor capabilities. The customer requires a flexible, high performance team that can work seamlessly with other contract teams, and across Sponsor organizations to deliver and sustain a coherent suite of solutions at the speed of mission despite reliance on numerous external capability providers. We're excited about candidates who:
  • Has an active TS/SCI Full Scope Poly * Demonstrated experience developing Web Applications
  • Demonstrated experience in API Design
  • Demonstrated experience in developing "drop-in" Web Components
  • Demonstrated experience in authoring and consuming Web Services.
  • Demonstrated experience in designing applications to support Deep Linking
  • Demonstrated experience in securely and efficiently facilitate searches within large distributed systems with "row-level" or "cell-level" security
  • Demonstrated experience in open source technologies and experience in pulling together multiple open source modules to satisfy a system requirement * Demonstrated experience in user engagements, soliciting requirements, decomposing into user stories
  • Demonstrated experience in User Experience design - to include Visual Design
  • Demonstrated experience developing Web Applications
  • Demonstrated experience in the full software development lifecycle. This includes development, deployment, testing, and monitoring.
  • Demonstrated experience in requirements definition
  • Demonstrated experience in Information Security, Assessment & Accreditation
  • Demonstrated on-the-job experience with Agile Methodologies. We're also excited about candidates who might have experience with the following:
  • Experience with: Linux (e.g. CentOS, Java, Python, Adobe Illustrator; Adobe Photoshop; or equivalent, HTML; CSS; & JavaScript, Angular; React; or Vue, Cross-origin Resource Sharing (CORS), REST, SOLR; ElasticSearch; or equivalent, NoSQL Data Sources (e.g. mongoDB, Cassandra, etc.), SQL & RDBMS Systems (e.g. Amazon RDS) Compensation: At GTech, we believe in treating every person the way we want to be treated - fairly . Our compensation package ensures everyone at GTech is given equal pay for equal work - regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, age, nationality, or even negotiation skills! Most IT companies can probably offer many of the same services, but what sets us apart from the others, is truly our people ! We care about our employees and show it often with sincere appreciation and acknowledgement of not only final work products, but the little steps taken along the way! In addition, our generous benefits package helps support our team members to live well and prosper. Here are just a few highlights: Four Week's Accrued PTO First Year
    • Ten Paid Federal Holidays
    Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurances
    401(k) Plan with Annual Employer Contributions
    Flexible Schedules
    Reimbursements for Continued Education and Training Why Graham Technologies? Our Core Values say it all!
  • Value our Customers
  • Care about our Employees
  • Passionate about Innovation
  • Believe in Strong Work Ethic
  • Rely on Teamwork
  • Integrity Matters Founded in 2007, GTech is a consulting-services firm that is zealous about providing the best solutions to address our client needs and maximize the value of their investments. One of the ways we do this, is by providing exceptional employees for our clients - whose range of expertise expands the entire IT industry! We've cultivated a family of individuals where integrity, commitment, and reliability, are etched into the heart of our delivery teams. In addition, we are equally zealous about caring for our employees - the lifeblood of our business ! We've purposefully created a culture that is friendly, family-oriented, and all-inclusive. Our team members are encouraged to "have a life", both in and out of the office, through flexible schedules (where available), continuing education, and support to pursue their passions! whole_unnormalized_body:
BravoTECH, a leader in IT staffing and staff augmentation services, seeks a Power BI Developer (Perm position) for our preferred Health Care Client in their Richardson, TX location

Overview

The Power BI Developer will be responsible for building Power BI Dashboards and reports. This individual will be a critical member of the team supporting various BI Projects. The Power BI Developer will partner with Business Analysts Team and Key Business leaders to understand their needs and then translates them into Reporting solutions that empower various business teams with actionable information which will result in improved business performance.

Responsibilities

Translate data and business requirements into informative visuals and reports

Develop visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards using Power BI desktop

Respond to requests from business areas to design, build, maintain or modify reports

Proficient in making DAX queries in Power BI desktop

Power BI development and administration

Building Analysis Services reporting models

Connecting to data sources, importing data and transforming data for Business Intelligence

Developing, publishing and scheduling Power BI reports as per the business requirements

Creates ad-hoc queries and reports to meet business requirements

Attains knowledge of the data warehouse and corresponding business information

Communicate open items and issues to management and development teams

Ability to be self-directed and accountable for produced reports

Ensure the quality, best practices and timeliness of reporting

Ability to produce clear, concise documentation on new and existing reports

Qualifications

Education Bachelor' s degree, preferably in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience.

Experience of 4+ years in data preparation, data gateway and data warehousing projects.

2+ years of experience working with Power BI.

Experience of 4+ years in SQL Server.

2+ years of experience writing complex SQL statements and performing data discovery

Experience creating calculated measures and columns with DAX in MS Power BI Desktop

Expert knowledge using advanced calculations using MS Power BI Desktop (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table)

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail

Ability to work in a teamcollaborative environment but to also work independently with the customer

Problem solver

Good judgment skills and sense of priorities

SSSISSRS is a plus

Please note All applicants may be subject to a criminal history check and drug screen.

About BravoTECH

BravoTECH is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Headquartered in Dallas, Texas, BravoTECH has provided technology staffing and consulting services to clients throughout the country since 1996. BravoTECH' s client-centric business model, driven by quality metrics, ensures consistent, predictable service results. As a result, the firm has realized steady growth and maintained many long-term relationships with its clients. BravoTECH is a WBE and HUB certified company and an Equal Opportunity Employer. IND123

job_description_details.Branża: Technologie i usługi informatyczne Oprogramowanie komputerowe Kadry i rekrutacja

whole_unnormalized_body:
We strive to keep learning and using the latest technologies from mobile (all platforms) to cloud (Azure) to big data (Hadoop/Cassandra) to IoT. You would work with a team of talented individuals who share a strong passion for problem solving and software. You will be developing application solutions through the complete SDLC in a fun, challenging, and casual environment

Qualifications
  • BA/BS degree
  • 3+ years of development experience in JAVA/J2EE
  • Strong understanding of Object Oriented Programming
  • Analyze and develop Java solutions based on customers’ needs
  • The ability to develop technical documentation
  • Proficient knowledge of Java & J2EE (including JSP, EJB, JDBC, SQL, XML, HTML and associated technologies) and the use of those technologies in n-tier development environments
  • Proficient knowledge is also expected in object-oriented application development principles, theories, and concepts using J2EE specific design patterns and usage
  • Web Services (RestFul & SOAP)
  • Experience with the use of version control systems for code management such as GIT, SVN, CVS
  • Ability to work on your own or with a team
  • Adaptability, organized, and a strong work ethic.

Nice To Haves
  • XML / JSON / HTML / Oracle DB / JavaScript / Angular

whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

Purpose

The Senior Solutions Analyst provides technical support regarding products, services and offers solutions advice to all aspects of Lighthouse’s cloud/SaaS offerings. Provide workflow consultation, drive the development of standards and coordinate and participate in the daily activities associated with providing support to clients. Provides strong leadership, subject matter expertise and consistent customer service across the range of Spectra-related service and support requests to ensure success of Lighthouse’s Spectra customers.

What You'll Do
  • Work with VP of Service Delivery, Manager Spectra Support and Sr. Product Manager to define, implement and execute the second tier support client experience for Lighthouse Spectra.
  • Act as lead when needed for the team of support professionals dedicated to Lighthouse Spectra Support.
  • Work with Sr. Product Manager to define key functionality and production direction for Spectra.
  • Subject matter expert of platforms and accountable for the second tier support client experience spanning Nuix, Relativity, eCapture, and Lighthouse’s proprietary technology, within Lighthouse Spectra Support offerings.
  • Provide workflow guidance and support across processing, review and production functions, for example, managing client escalations, generating and providing analysis of key reports, and participating and preparing for client business meetings.
  • Provides sales support, marketing support, and thought leadership content for Lighthouse Spectra Support
  • Key liaison and customer advocate, ensuring customer needs are observed and fulfilled, between the customer; first tier customer support representatives; and various Lighthouse business units including Service Delivery, Finance, IT, and Product Development.
  • Responsible for ensuring customers are utilizing Lighthouse Spectra Support offerings appropriately and identifying when the customer experience requires migrating the customer to a full service delivery model.
  • Primary point-person for coordinating transition between Lighthouse Spectra Support and Service Delivery, working closely with the Lighthouse Spectra Support team, Lighthouse business units, and the customer.
  • Identify opportunities to drive client success through advanced culling methods, improved review workflows, efficient production options, normalization of incoming data, and better client-side workflows
  • Train new team members on Lighthouse Spectra Support offerings and practices; create and document scalable processes within the offerings
  • Support the strategic direction of product development as well as service and process offerings; analyze client feedback to make recommendations for improvement and/or development of new functionality or features.
  • Maintain relevant technical and professional knowledge of applications, the discovery process, equipment, and related topics through training, vendor meetings, seminars, vendor materials and documentation, self-study, user group meetings inside and outside the company, industry networking, and professional journals
  • Other duties as assigned.

What You'll Need
  • Able to support Eastern Standard Time (8:30am - 5:30pm EST)
  • BS/BA or equivalent degree or equivalent preferred
  • Juris Doctor, paralegal degree, and PMP certification desired
  • 6-9 years of ediscovery SME or related experience
  • 2+ years of leadership responsibilities desired
  • Excellent customer service and troubleshooting skills, including experience in real-time problem-solving
  • Experience providing technical service to clients via phone and email, as well as modern collaboration platforms such as chat, screen-sharing technology, video conferencing, etc.
  • Experience managing client budgetary and financial expectations
  • Experience growing new businesses / business units
  • Excellent knowledge of legal discovery process and concepts
  • Demonstrated talent for communication across many groups, personalities, and pressures--both internal staff and clients
  • Deep experience with legal technology platforms (Nuix, Relativity, and eCapture or equivalent); eDiscovery best practices (collection, processing, review and production practices); and providing customers with standardized and customized deliverables
