position: Jr. ServiceNow Developer with Security Clearance- Apply now!
whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

Job Title: Jr Service Now Developer
Location: Blacksburg/Abingdon, VA
Clearance Requirement: Eligibility for a Government Public Trust (SF-85) background investigation (US Citizenship required)
***This position is contingent upon contract award***
Who Are We?
1901 Group prides itself on looking ahead of our competitors for the next wave of IT trends. We provide our employees with training and development opportunities, preparing them for upcoming technical challenges. With primary office locations in Blacksburg and Reston, VA, our teams support customers from across the United States. Our innovative IT As-A Service delivery model is supported by industry certifications that ensure quality and efficient IT solutions.
We are transforming the delivery of IT services through the use of enterprise managed services that leverage the cloud to securely monitor, manage, and optimize complex IT environments.
The history of automation is what inspired the name of our company. 1901 was the year that another disruptive technology changed the world: the assembly line. Leveraging skills and materials in an efficient manner within a repeatable process that quadrupled output applies to IT services today.

Who We Need

Motivated early career developers to design and develop software tools and solutions for our ServiceNow IT services platform. What You'll Spend Most of Your Time Doing * After your initial onboarding and acclimation to the team, you will work with a team of highly skilled software developers responsible for delivering customized solutions for federal and commercial clients.
  • You will work to develop core functionality for existing systems, create and execute tests, and assist with deployment of new software to the user community. * Work prioritized tasks from implementation through test and deployment during each two-week Agile Sprint period * Collaborate with other software developers, operations staff, supervisors, and clients * Provide team leads with technical and schedule input to ensure development activities proceed as needed As a Jr Service Now Developer you will: * Follow software best practices to design and implement well documented, maintainable code * Analyze, diagnose, and resolve software bugs utilizing approved procedures * Create and successfully execute unit tests Are You: * A software developer with a Bachelor's degree and 1+ year's experience developing and supporting software applications, specifically common programming languages such as Java, or C#?
  • A developer with working knowledge of scripting languages such as JavaScript, Python, Bash, etc, and familiarity with application frameworks such as Angula JS, Java EE, etc?
  • Familiar with RESTful APIs, JSON, AJAX, XHTML, and SOAP?
  • Someone with excellent oral and written communication skills?
  • A US Citizen who can obtain and maintain a public trust clearance?
  • It would be also be great if you:
  • Are familiar with the ServiceNow platform
  • Have Knowledge of Agile Scrum development methodologies and processes * Are familiar with design and development of web services * Are familiar with relational databases, database design, and data modeling Successful Traits in this Role include:
Detailed oriented
Team player
Collaborator
Problem solver
Analytical
Minimum Essential Functions: * Travel to customer sites, including overnight travel
  • Working overtime as assigned [non-exempt employees only]
  • Assessing risk of technical solution paths
  • Reporting to a senior program ownerWhy 1901 Group is a Great Place to Work
Benefits

The health and happiness of our employees and their families is our top priority. That's why we offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package to help you and your loved ones feel secure. We strive to create the best experience for you, so you can continue doing the things you love. The following represents an overview of our offerings:

Health & Wellness * 1901 Group offers above-industry standard, high-quality medical, pharmacy, dental and vision plans. A single carrier supports our offerings of two medical, two dental and a single, comprehensive vision plan.
  • Two Telehealth/Telemedicine services as part of the medical plan, allowing you to get the care you need - including most prescriptions - for a wide range of minor conditions.Flexible Payment Options via Pretax Deductions * Health Savings Account (HSA)
  • Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account
  • Limited Purpose Flexible Spending AccountPaid Time Off * Generous leave options to include: vacation, sick leave, all major and federal holidays, jury duty, bereavement, military leave, maternity, and paternity leave.Retirement Savings * Pre-tax and Roth 401(k) Savings Programs with company matchCoverage for the Unexpected or "Just in Case" Moments * Two Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs)
  • Company-paid Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
  • Company-paid Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance for Employees, Spouses, and ChildrenOur Focus on Professional & Team Growth:
At 1901 Group we empower our employees with exponential career development and growth opportunities by utilizing a more modern form of employee assessment - quarterly reviews. We put our employees in the driver's seat of their evaluation process - and their development. Learning and development is offered through a variety of platforms, designed to satisfy different learners at different stages within their careers. Employee-Driven Performance Management & Learning
We support a philosophy and approach where "Everyone Learns". Whether it be via online training or domain specific classroom & instructor lead training - we anticipate our employees will constantly seek out new ways to improve themselves - personally and professionally.

Other Considerations

Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation. Individual's primary workstation is located in an office area with overhead lighting. The noise level in this environment is low to moderate. Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc. Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of time.
This position profile incorporates the core responsibilities of the job. It is recognized that other related duties not specifically mentioned may also be performed, and that not all responsibilities may be carried out depending on operational needs. Nothing in this profile restricts management's rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
1901 Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer
1901 Group is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. 1901 Group "Contingent" offers for employment may stipulate that one or more requirements be satisfied before final commitment between candidate and 1901 Group is established; namely, award of contract to the 1901 Group. Contingent requirements vary and may also include, but not be limited to additional factors (i.e., the position still being available after negotiations with the Government; final approval of your qualifications by the Government; or ability to successfully acquire and/or transfer a DoD security clearance) U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

1901 Group Is a Drug Free Workplace. Description

Cadogan Tate New York Limited is recruiting for Art Handlers to work in our warehouse. The essential function of this role is to handle and pack artworks, antiquities and fine furniture, working with the crating department.This would involve accurate condition reporting of the pieces being handled.

The Successful Candidate Will Have The Following Attributes
  • A minimum of two years of related work experience in a warehouse
  • A knowledge of proper handling of art, antiquities and high-end furniture using the appropriate materials and methods for packaging, loading and securing for safe transport.
  • A desire to work as part of a team and wants the company to be successful.
  • Familiarity with paperwork; Bills of Lading, Condition Reports, Inventory, etc.
  • Ability to communicate fluently in written and spoken English
  • Must be able to lift 70 lbs
  • Ability to thrive in a busy environment
  • Professional appearance and demeanor
This a full-time position, working Monday through Friday. The company provides competitive hourly pay and excellent benefits. Benefits will become available to successful full-time candidates upon completion of the probationary period. The candidate must be able to provide proof of authorization to work in the U.S.

whole_unnormalized_body:
Description

The Information Risk Management Consultant is responsible for assessing the organization's security risks and identifying ways to mitigate those risks. This role will report to the Information Risk Management & Security Architecture Leader and will work closely with the security architecture team to review existing and new IT solutions and services to determine the risks presented and their mitigations. This individual will also need to work with other IT and business leaders to ensure that security best practices and Corteva security policies are being followed. The Information Risk Management Consultant will also contribute to improvements in the risk assessment process and its application to the Security and IT architectural processes.

Who are we, and what do we do?

Corteva Agriscience™ creates the world's most recognized and premium agricultural solutions to address the greatest challenges in agriculture. With a focus on technology, Corteva Agriscience™ creates seed and crop protection products that increase productivity and profit for farmers while reducing risks to their business. Every day our digital tools deliver insights our global partners need to thrive now and into the future.

As the world’s first dedicated agriculture start-up, we’re building a culture that stays curious, thinks differently, acts boldly and takes a stand on what’s right for our customers, our co-workers, our partners and our planet. We know we’ve got big challenges to solve - we hope you'll be part of the solution. Whether you are in the lab or on the farm, teaching classes or crafting code - we need bold thinkers and fearless doers to bring their best to the job at hand. Every role at Corteva Agriscience™ includes an opportunity to grow what matters.

Responsibilities

How will you help us grow? It matters to us, and it matters to you!
  • Review proposed IT solutions and services to evaluate cloud services, applications, systems and related technology using a standardized risk assessment process and develop risk assessment reports.
  • Conduct ongoing reviews of the existing Corteva infrastructure and applications to address any significant technical changes, outstanding risks and changes to the threat environment.
  • Select and allocate appropriate security controls for information systems based on data types, validate effectiveness of current controls, and identify potential gaps.
  • Identify, prioritize, and determine security risk impacts to the information systems and its data.
  • Determine potential impact of detected gaps and translate that into risk within the established framework.
  • Monitor information systems findings, remediation plans, recommendations, risk mitigation strategies, risk acceptance and milestones.
  • Review assessment results for vulnerabilities, gaps, and control deficiencies and work with IT and business stakeholders to establish plans for sustainable resolution.
  • Work collaboratively with security architects, application teams, Corteva Security leadership and business owners to ensure the Corteva security policies and standards are clearly defined and disseminated.
  • Work with IT and business stakeholders to educate them on Corteva security policies and standards and the requirements for risk assessments.
  • Evaluate security risk management from similar companies and other industries to determine best practices that should be considered for inclusion in Corteva risk management.
  • Deliver information technology security consulting services in support of evaluations, initiatives, and Risk Assessment efforts being conducted in the organization.

Accountabilities
  • Familiarity with Governance, Risk, and Compliance platforms and processes for tracking and aggregating data from risk assessments.
  • Ability to identify, assesses and document the severity and potential impact of risks and communicate risk assessment findings to risk owners in a way that consistently drives objective, fact-based decisions.

Qualifications

Requirements:

What expertise have you grown? What do you bring to the table?

Technical Competencies
  • Experience with developing risk assessment and mitigation approaches for implementing cloud solutions (IaaS, SaaS, etc.), digital platforms, mobile applications or tools, and innovative technologies
  • Knowledge of IT infrastructure: applications, databases, operating systems — Windows, Unix and Linux, hypervisors, IP networks — WAN and LAN, storage networks — Fibre Channel, iSCSI and NAS, backup networks and media.
  • Experience with common security frameworks (ISO, NIST, COBIT, etc.) and Privacy Frameworks (GDPR, HIPAA, PIPEDA, etc.).
  • Leadership Competencies
  • Experience working in or with Fortune 500 companies for at least three years in a risk management role.
  • Experience with the development of security risk assessments and mitigation plans.
  • Knowledge and experience with data analytics technologies is desired.
  • Knowledge of OT security considerations, including ICS and safety systems desired.
  • Exposure to R&D environments desired.
  • Executive level presentation skills required.

Experience & Education Required
  • Five or more years of broad and diverse information security experience with advanced understanding of both technical and non-technical controls and the ability to effectively apply this knowledge when performing assessments.
  • At least three years of risk management experience including working knowledge of security domains, auditing standards and frameworks, and risk analysis frameworks including ISO, NIST Cyber Security Framework, IT-CMF, etc.
  • Bachelor’s Degree; Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity or related fields are highly desired but not required.
  • While not required, certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CISA are desired.

Benefits

Let’s peek at how you can grow your wellbeing, health, and future at Corteva!
  • Strike a better work-life balance with robust time off benefits including paid maternity, paternal and family illness leave
  • Prepare for your future with our competitive retirement savings plan, tuition reimbursement program, and more
  • Enjoy access to health benefits for you and your family on your first day of employment
  • And much, much more!

Ready to grow your perspectives, impact and career? Start by applying to this opportunity today!

whole_unnormalized_body:
Start a Rewarding Career with Alliant

What will your day look like?

You will be responsible for setting the strategy for the translating business requirements into the Data Warehouse data model for use in the Business Intelligence platform, to oversee the development of data extraction and integration routines and to incorporate data quality and validation routines. This position will also create/maintain the logical and physical data models, lead the effort for a Business Glossary to empower Self-Service Analytics, and for conversion of business requirements into detailed technical designs. You must understand the dimensional/relational modeling techniques and bridge the gap between the OLTP developers, data warehouse developers, and DBA teams.

A key responsibility is to work with business stakeholders and peers (such as Business Analysts, Data Integration and Business Intelligence Engineers, DBAs, and business owners) to enhance the organization’s enterprise data warehouse.

The Data Modeler will be expected to leverage their deep technical knowledge of data modeling and data integration best practices along with cross industry data expertise to empower the business to make data-driven decisions.

Responsibilities

 Do you see yourself doing this?
  • Translates and transforms business requirements into data models (Conceptual, Logical and Physical)
  • Expert knowledge in dimensional data modeling, ETL processes, data integration applications and business intelligence tools. SAP Business Objects and Tableau a plus.
  • Interacts with OLTP systems and translated relational models into dimensional models.
  • Drives conversations with development teams and DBA teams to optimize the schema structure and ingestion processes influencing the write and read performance
  • Participates in collaborations to transform business requirements into ETL and data validation designs. This includes knowledge sharing and mentoring fellow team members.
  • Evaluates source system data and data models
  • Assists with capturing and documenting system flow and other pertinent technical information about data database design and/or systems
  • Address data related problems in regards to systems architecture, integration, compatibility, and multiple-platform integration

Qualifications

 What makes you a great fit?

You’ll Be a Great Fit If In Addition To The Completion Of a Bachelor’s Degree In Computer Science Or a Related Field, 3+ Years Of Experience Writing And Tuning Complex SQL (T-SQL In SQL Server), And You Have
  • Experience with software quality assurance testing, release procedures, coding design and documentation protocol.
  • Solid experience using Informatica PowerCenter in a Data Warehouse environment. Experience in Informatica Data Transformation and Metadata Manager a plus.
  • Proven success working in a collaborative and Agile environment (Scrum methodology a plus).
  • Demonstrates analytical thinking and strong problem solving skills
  • Strong working knowledge across the technology stack including ETL, data analysis, metadata, data quality, audit and design
  • Experience or exposure to SAP Business Objects & Crystal, Tableau, Hadoop, and CA ErWin
  • Proven background designing and architecting ETL solutions as part of a cross-functional team
  • Experience in making hardware recommendations, sizing, and configuration for development systems
  • Experience in Hybrid Cloud based implementations and architecture preferred. Azure experience a plus.
When you’re happy, we’re happy!

As a thank you for joining our team, you’ll benefit from:
  • Competitive medical, dental, and free vision benefits
  • Competitive compensation plan
  • Contributions towards gym memberships
  • Generous PTO and banking holidays off
Still not convinced?

We’re on the list of 100 Best Medium Companies to work for, check it out here . For more details you can also visit our Glassdoor and LinkedIn profiles.

Options

Apply for this job online Apply

Share

Refer this job to a friend Refer

whole_unnormalized_body:
Industry Weapon of Pittsburgh, PA is seeking to hire a full-time Systems Administrator to maintain our data centers, servers, software, and monitoring. This information technology position helps to ensure that both our office services and our production services are up and running for our team and our clients. Are you an information technology (IT) professional with scripting knowledge? Do you enjoy troubleshooting data center equipment? If so, keep reading!

Systems Administrators enjoy a competitive salary plus excellent benefits including medical (PPO plan with RX coverage), premium dental plan, vision plan, term life and short-term disability insurance, and an excellent 401k plan. Additionally, we provide 120 hours of paid time off that can be earned per the calendar year, seven holidays, and monthly team lunches! If this sounds like the right opportunity to put your information technology expertise to work, apply today!

About Industry Weapon

Since opening for business in 2007, we've enjoyed our role as scrappy underdogs who fight for our customers. It all started when we saw an opportunity to help our customers make sense of the digital signage landscape because there didn't seem to be many places people could go for transparent information about digital signage. We provide a place they could go to determine the equipment they truly needed -- instead of being seduced by unnecessary bells and whistles and the high cost that went with it. Going out of our way to make sure our customers could get that information to thrive now and in the future has been our driving force.

Now we're quite proud of our scrappy identity. In fact, we're so proud it's become our mission to not only fight for our customers but others who need our help and support too. Whether it's gathering fresh produce to feed the hungry, showing solidarity in anti-bullying campaigns, or celebrating team member achievements -- we take our role seriously. If you want to work with a team of passionate, high-performing, talented people, then apply today!

A DAY IN THE LIFE AS A SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR

Each day is exciting in the world of information technology. As a Systems Administrator, you monitor and maintain our network operations center as well as our main product-the CommandCenterHD cloud service. Your dedication to planning for the future expansion of the processing infrastructure is critical to our success.

You maintain data centers, servers, storage, software, firewalls, switches, routers, VPN, and other networking components. Using hand tools and a computer tool kit, you perform hardware maintenance on servers, routers, and switches. You negotiate and coordinate the maintenance and purchasing contracts regarding our software and hardware.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree OR an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 5+ years of relevant experience and/or training
  • Working knowledge of programming, databases, computer network technologies, personal computer hardware, and troubleshooting
  • Proficiency with Hypervisor administration, server administration, firewall, VPN, router and switch management, SAN administration, networking, and environmental controls
  • Proficiency with Cisco equipment and Linux CentOS operating system
  • Microsoft Active Directory experience is a plus

Are you self-motivated and able to work well independently? Are you detail oriented and able to multitask? Do you have excellent communication skills and the ability to explain technical information in layman's terms? If so, you may be perfect for this Systems Administrator position!

READY TO JOIN OUR INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY TEAM?

If you have programming experience and feel that you would be right for this Systems Administrator position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

whole_unnormalized_body:
Job Description

SNI Technology is currently looking for a AWS/EMR Java Developer for a Fortune 500 Company.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have
    • 8+ years of programming or solutions lead experience with Java, J2EE, Spring, and Web Services (REST, SOAP, etc.)
    • Hands-on experience designing, developing, and administering solutions using ETL, Business Intelligence tools and emerging technologies
    • 6 years of experience writing conceptual and detailed design documents, and developing external facing enterprise applications following an Agile execution model
    • Minimum 4 years of experience in developing/deploying solutions to AWS Cloud (S3, Lambda, Elastic Beanstalk and other AWS modules)
    • Experience in developing/deploying solutions using Neo4j and GraphQL
    • Experience in developing data matching algorithms and data modelling
    • Demonstrated experience with the use of Design patterns and ability to use commonly used patterns in real time situations.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Nice to have Skillset:
    • Mongo DB
    • Apigee / API Gateway
    • Web Services
    • Python
  • Looking for Doer's - candidates need to be able to do hands on development

Desired Amount of Experience Advanced skills in SQL with writing database scripts, stored procedures, functions, triggers and ISS packages. Required 4 Years Advanced skills in C.NET, VB.NET httpvb.net , ASP.NET httpasp.net , XML, AJAX, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Transact SQL (T-SQL), TypeScript Required 4 Years Knowledge of structured programming, object-oriented programming, relational database constructs, dynamic responsive web development Required 4 Years Advanced skills in unit testing, system testing, regression testing, and automated testing to ensure product quality meet client expectation. Required 4 Years Ability to provide quality customer service, build trust through integrity of work, and build strategic relationships through teamwork. Required 4 Years Ability to communicate technical terminology at a level appropriate to the audience. Required 4 Years Skills in MS Visual Studio, MS Team Foundation Server, MS Office suite, MS Sharepoint, Azure DevOps Required 4 Years Angular Required 2 Years Required Experience Advanced skills in C.NET, ASP.NET httpasp.net , CSS3, Bootstrap, HTML5, JavaScript, SQL, AJAX, XML, AngularJS, Angular, TypeScript, Azure DevOps are required. Advanced skills writing database scripts, stored procedures, functions, triggers, and ISS packages are required. Job Description Serve as a Senior ProgrammerAnalyst under the guidance of the immediate supervisor or Specialist level ProgrammerAnalyst. Use basic principles and procedures of methodology, and automated data processing to design, develop, debug, test, and maintain highly complex software applications. These applications exist on a wide variety of platforms including PC-based, Web-based, Mobile, and Mainframe. Legacy application development and maintenance may require knowledge of other platforms. bull Participate in daily scrums, project planning, and project review meetings. bull Design and document IT solutions which conform to State of Michigan standard technology. bull Provide professional technical expertise to the PMO Managers and client agency managers and supervisors in IT project estimating, and budgeting. bull Design scripts and coordinate application peer testing, load testing and system integration testing. bull Create, update, and maintain systems and IT programs documentation, including system specs and flow diagrams. bull Develop software code based on design. bull Design solutions for a specific application need. bull Code to standards. bull Work with the business client to create test scenarios. Design and develop test plans, applications, or subsystems. bull Provide defect tracking log entry information. bull Test the database and associated design to ensure compliance with the business rules which govern the database. bull Implement IT solutions. bull Maintain and upgrade systems as a result of tool upgrades. bull Documents identified problems and analyze to determine root cause and provide root cause analysis. bull Follow change management procedures and provide input to execute change management. bull Work with vendors who provide IT solutions. bull Represents DTMB as a technical resource at meeting. bull Performs assigned tasks for internalexternal security and standards review and development. bull Identify potential impacts of changes. bull Research, test and recommend new development tools, languages, upgrades and equipment as directed by senior team members. bull Apply State government processes to systems that support the DNR, EGLE, and MDARD. bull Apply Agency business rules to system and program design. bull Document changes to existing programs using standards established by DTMB management. bull Follow clientrsquos policies for access and distribution of reports and data. bull Maintain work log and status. bull Perform tasks for internalexternal security and standards review as directed. bull Follow DTMB Problem Management processes to resolve client problems reported through Remedy trouble tickets, phone calls and email. bull Update assigned trouble tickets with status comments to keep clients and co-workers informed.
